title: Program Catalog Mining Engineering

vision_mission.slu_vision: An excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered individuals who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
vision_mission.school_vision: An exemplary educational institution for engineering and architecture dedicated to elevating instruction, research, and extension to a higher level of competence and creativity, committed to shaping the socio-technical environment founded on Christian values.

educational_objectives: Demonstrate technical competence in solving problems and designing systems with awareness of professional, societal, environmental, and ethical aspects.
Apply Christian values—honesty, service, dedication, and moral responsibility—in their profession.
Engage in advanced education, research, and development.
Contribute actively to addressing national social, technical, and business challenges.
learning_outcomes: Apply knowledge of math, science, and engineering fundamentals to complex engineering problems.
Conduct investigations using research-based knowledge, experiments, data analysis, and synthesis.
Design solutions with consideration of public health, safety, culture, and the environment.
Function effectively individually and in diverse/multidisciplinary teams.
Analyze and draw conclusions from complex engineering problems.
Commit to ethical principles and professional responsibilities.
Communicate effectively with the engineering community and society.
Evaluate sustainability and societal impact of engineering solutions.
Engage in lifelong learning amid technological changes.
Assess societal, health, safety, and legal issues relevant to engineering practice.
Use modern engineering and IT tools, recognizing their limitations.
Apply management principles and economic decision-making in team and project settings.
Practice Christian values as Louisians serving the CICM mission.

core_subjects: Engineering Chemistry, Physics, and Math (Pre-Calculus to Differential and Integral Calculus)
pe_nstp_courses: Physical Fitness, Aquatics, Outdoor Activities, Combative Sports
notes: Maximum Load: Regular semester = Regular load + 6 units, Short term = Regular load + 3 units
Year Level Determination: Based on 70% of enrolled subjects
Regular students = No back or advanced subjects

freshmen: Must pass the SLU College Entrance Exam (SLU-CEE)
Must qualify within available course slots
transferees: Required: Qualifying Exam (QE), Personality Test, Interview
Foreign transferees must also pass the English Proficiency Test (EPT)

graduate_students.doctorate: Must hold a related Master’s degree

foreign_students: Apply at least 6 months before the start of term
Arrive in Baguio 4 weeks before class for EPT and admission exams
Must pass EPT, SLU-CEE/QE/GPEE, and Personality Test
Must secure a valid Student Visa

tuition_and_fees.note: Fees subject to change without prior notice
